questions.question: How does the offspring produced by asexual reproduction compare to the parent organism?

choices.answer: All of its genetic information is the same as the parent.
Its genetic information is completely different from the parent organism.
One half of its genetic information is the same as the parent organism
One quarter of its genetic information is the same as the parent organism.

questions.question: The Venn diagram below is used to compare and contrast asexual and sexual reproduction.Which statement would go in both?

choices.answer: Always involves meiosis
Genetic information passes to the next generation
Involves mitosis, but not meiosis
Genetic information from two organisms combines

questions.question: Which is the primary advantage to sexual reproduction over asexual reproduction?

choices.answer: The offspring are identical to parents.
The offspring are born alive, rather than from eggs.
There is longer development time for offspring.
The offspring inherit a wider variety of genetic information.

questions.question: He concludes that the root cells are reproducing by mitosis. Which hypothesis is supported by this conclusion?

choices.answer: The root tissue cells split to form stem cells.
The root tissue cells all have the same number of chromosomes.
The root tissue cells have the same genetic makeup.
The root tissue cells are genetically different from the parent cells.

questions.question: What is a difference between mitosis and meiosis?

choices.answer: Mitosis occurs in plants and animals while meiosis occurs in bacteria.
Mitosis- separating chromosomes, meiosis only involves the cytoplasm.
Mitosis-1 cell divides into 2 cells and meiosis- 2 cells combine to make 1.
Mitosis- products identical to parent cell, meiosis- products are different

questions.question: Which of the following identifies reproduction in Spirogyra as sexual reproduction?

choices.answer: The cells of parent algae have nuclei.
Several offspring may be produced at once.
Each offspring contains chloroplasts.
Genetic material is contributed by two parent cells.

questions.question: What cellular process is directly responsible for this regeneration?

choices.answer: Mitosis
Respiration
Meiosis
Transpiration

questions.question: “As humans grow, their bodies change.” Which statement best explains how humans grow?

choices.answer: Cells increase in size.
Cells undergo cell division.
Cells form a cell wall.
Cells merge to become larger.

questions.question: Roses grown from sexually produced seeds may look different from either parent. Which statement best supports this?

choices.answer: Sexually produced plants are a new species.
Asexual reproduction helps plants adapt to different environments.
Sexual reproduction produces more variation in plants.
Asexually produced plants are prettier than sexually produced plants.

questions.question: The offspring of Astrammina rara have genes identical to the parent.

choices.answer: Involves an egg and a sperm
Reduces the variation in the offspring
Requires a male and a female
Increases the variation in the offspring
